intro: Banisteriopsis variabilis, commonly known as the variable banisteria, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native ecosystems.
